text: this is our movement director of time
out of mind although this scene comes
very late in the movie this is the first
thing we shot Richard Gere playing
George Hammond a man without a home
entering the homeless shelter system in
New York City is panhandling kind of get
some money to buy some booze basically
we shot this as an experiment to see if
we can put Richard Gere in live
environments standing basically in the
middle of astor place by the cue was now
gone and asking people in a very
monotonous way for money we were afraid
that he would be recognized immediately
and I would take away the basic concept
of the movie of using live environments
but to our surprise no one noticed him
it helped that we hid the camera we put
it the starbucks across the street so
there was no footprint for the actual
crew and Richard was standing there for
a long time the scene actually was 45
minutes long at first very kind of
lethargic and then getting a little bit
more aggressive by the end of it you see
he's kind of left alone
